I myself own an Airbnb and when setting it up, i thought a few thing were most important for guests. 1) comfortable beds. 2) great AC that pumps when itâ€™s hot and fans in all bedrooms . 3) Big TVs. 4) hot water and lastly 5) very clean. Also, I canâ€™t stay somewhere that smells and this didnâ€™t have a hint of any bad smellğŸ˜†.
This place has it all and was perfect. My son played a golf tournament at FSUs course so being close to campus was important for us. Close to all the restaurants and bars, across the street from the stadium and better than a nice hotel. My son didnâ€™t finish his tournament until about 3PM yesterday and Kelly was accommodating, letting us check out after so we can shower before driving 8 hours. This is a no brainer for anyone heading to Tallahassee that wants a bit more than a hotel without paying crazy money. As far as Kelly, she was as nice as someone can be. 10/10 for this place

I stayed at the treehouse for two work trips back to back and couldn't be happier with my time there. Jennifer was very accommodating the first time when I told her about a car issues and was flexible with the check out time. The second time, I left a pair of earrings, which she quickly offered to send back to me.
The place itself has a cozy interior that feels like coming back home. The balcony is lovely and offers a peaceful view of the wooded area in the backyard. When I checked in both times, they had everything set up and a space heater on to ensure I'd be comfortable from the moment I stepped in.
One thing I really appreciated about this room is how many electrical plugs there are. I never had to search or go far to find one when needed.
Overall, this is a really great place if you're looking for a cozy and private getaway in Tallahassee.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a lovely wooded setting. Instructions were clear and easy for access in and out of the space. Someone greeted us on arrival and showed us how to operate the space heater. Exterior lighting was good. The WiFi was easy to access. The place is small, but has a king-size bed and two desks. The futon-sofa is close to the bed, has a firm hardness, and will work well for someone shorter than 6 feet tall. The bed and bath linens are clean and of good quality. The hot water was an extra treat especially in the shower. Interesting reading materials and games were available and organized--we especially enjoyed the book on the history of airbnb. The weather was too cold for us to take the walking paths or to swim in the pool, but would be enjoyable in warm weather. The local co-op market was easy to drive to and offered good choices in food. The host provided use privacy during our stay. There was one power problem that the host fixed immediately and easily after we called.

name: Jenna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is AWESOME. I cannot believe the attention to detail the host has put in. Upon entering you'll find an adorable quirky guidebook that will tell you anything and everything you need to know about the place, the things in it, the surrounding area, and even Jennifer herself! There's a bag with sunscreen and bug spray, there's shaving cream and razors, feminine hygiene, a nail kit, cotton swabs, air freshener spray in the bathroom, it's like someone ACTUALLY lives here. Nothing was left out. Don't know how to use a fire extinguisher? You will after reading the guidebook lol. You'll also enjoy local magazines, tourist brochures, and 2 nice cold waters bottled IN Florida. In the morning you'll find a dozen varieties of tea - and not your boring old Lipton and Celestial Seasonings ğŸ™„ Someone actually knows decent tea. Bigelow Earl Grey is one of my all time favorites. There's also twinnings, stash, and yogi. The coffee is great, the creamer could be better but THANK YOU for having ANY - so many places don't? And bless your soul for having both a coffee pot and a FRENCH PRESS ğŸ‘Œ Living for the options. I'm from Michigan, so even in early April when it drops to 55 I can't ever imagine turning on the heater. But there's a very cute heater unit and a great air conditioner, both with remotes so you never have to elbow the hubby to fix em in the middle of the night. I actually really liked the shampoo and body wash, the water pressure was a little lacking, but maybe that's just my desire to be power washed lol.
When she said private, she meant it! The neighborhood is quiet (minus all the lovely wildlife of course! Lots of birds and frogs) and you're not sharing the property (OR POOL) with other guests.
We're obsessed with the integrated blinds LOL so cool and unique! I've never seen those before. I wanted to stand there opening and closing them for hours - but didn't wanna break em so I resisted ğŸ˜‚
Can we talk about the BED?! OMG. Perfect mattress, not too firm, and the pillows are BIG and absolutely to die for. I'm so picky about my bed and pillows, I've never had a good night sleep anywhere on the road, BUT I DID HERE! I'm one of those sensory issue folks that has 100 pillows and is never satisfied with them, but these are a dream. I'm about to ask if I can buy one ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£
I went on a walk through the neighborhood, it's very nice and easily walkable! In 3.3 miles (took roughly an hour) we saw 4 different parks, several restaurants and 3 bars! Lots of turtles, frogs, tadpoles, ducks and geese. We did a circuit of parks ending with World Of Beer, which had an amazing giant pretzel, burgers to die for, and a lovely sour beer! It was about 35 dollars per person, so keep that in mind. Unfortunately the very close bar The Moon was closed the day we had time to go ğŸ˜­ but that just means we'll have to stop by again!
Potential cons : are you from the north? Never been to non-coastal Florida? It's HOT and HUMID. You're basically in the swamp, buckle up snow bird! (I knew what I was asking for, but for those who don't be aware haha)
Are you a smoker? You'll notice it says smoke free property and they ask you don't smoke in the room, which is great because even though I do smoke I hate a stinky room, we did however smoke on the balcony and nothing was said about it, but be prepared to bring your own ashtray or cheap bowl! Don't be a littering jerk ğŸ˜¤ğŸ™„ Some parts of the neighborhood seem to just not have a sidewalk or pedestrian lane? I feel like I'd be nervous walking with a stroller/little one in those areas. Though to be fair I only saw about 4 cars in total and the speed limit is 20.

We did hear the family from time to time on the other side of door linked to the main house kitchen.

name: Warren
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Suzanne was very kind, hospitable and her suite was super cozy. Live plants, big front windows that let in plenty of natural light, and warm low-level lighting made me feel like I was a guest at one of my own family member's home - even the smell of the suite was strangely familiar to me (in no way a bad smell!). The side entrance was convenient and the driveway space provided was ample for my full sized truck. Keep in mind this is a suite that shares an interior wall with Suzanne's home, so occupants can be heard from either side of the wall. That being said, Suzanne repeatedly messaged me to make sure her and her company were not disturbing us. One night they were playing acoustic guitar and singing songs, but it was not loud or disturbing, could not be heard over our TV volume and they stopped before 8pm. I only bring up the topic for those who have not stayed in an attached suite before. We were very happy and would stay with Suzanne again! 10/10 host and living space!

Â·

review_text: We needed a base for a visit with our grandchildren and this worked very nicely. The unit is basically a private studio with a very nice screened porch. There is a kitchenette with a small sink, toaster oven, microwave, hot plate and full size refrigerator. The king size bed was very comfortable. It is close to a major shopping area, but very quiet. The negatives: poor water pressure, intermittent mildew smell (but the airport also had that smell, and ventilating the room helped), internet wifi signal was weak. There are very few rentals available in north Tallahassee and we were thankful this was available. We definitely hope to return.

I like concise pros & cons in a review.
Pros:
â€¢ Very clean
â€¢ Easy check in
â€¢ Safe & quiet neighborhood
â€¢ Convenient to shopping & restaurants
â€¢ Adequate interior space & parking
â€¢ Comfortable bed
â€¢ Good seating & work space
â€¢ Good cycling & running options
â€¢ Easy access to I-10
Cons:
â€¢ Air conditioning window unit is loud
â€¢ No hot water at kitchen for cleaning dishes
â€¢ No hot water at bathroom sink unless shower water is turned on
â€¢ Water pressure in bathroom is on the low side
â€¢ No smoke detector
â€¢ Interior space was humid without the air conditioner on
â€¢ Listing says kitchen but there is not a stove. The listing does have a microwave, hot plate, toaster oven and coffee pot.
We felt safe and comfortable and would recommend this property.

review_text: Katie's Airbnb was perfect for our needs! The area was absolutely beautiful and so peaceful. It felt like we were a million miles away but only a short drive from necessities like stores and restaurants. The bed was the most comfortable Airbnb bed I can recall and I actually slept well, which is hard for me when traveling. One of my favorite parts is that I was lulled to sleep by the sound of crickets and frogs at the lake nearby each evening. A/C was super effective and cold (something important to me in the crazy Florida heat). The shower had great pressure and everything was super clean. Katie was also very accommodating with scheduling, which we greatly appreciated. Originally our trip was supposed to be in May, then December, and finally happened in August and each time Katie was super understanding of the factors outside my control that led to so much change. We will absolutely stay at this Airbnb again in the future when we travel back down to Tallahassee!

review_text:
I visited Tallahassee to see my daughter and grand daughter. Katieâ€™s cabin was clean, quiet, and larger than I expected. I wanted a place that felt rural but was still just a short drive from my daughterâ€™s apartment. Katieâ€™s location and surroundings were perfect! I loved watching the sunrise and sunset from the porch. Sunset over the large pond/small lake was especially beautiful. I saw Great Blue Herons, Bitterns, Anhingas, and Great White Egrets, Red Tail Hawks, and watched a Seallow Tail Hawk catch fish from the lake.
My grand daughter loved coming by and seeing the longhorn cows across the lake. It was too chilly to try the kayaks, but hoping for another visit at a warmer time. The cabin had everything I needed and the best equipped kitchen of all my BnB stays to date. Katie answered texts quickly. Her home is right next door, but the cabin is situated so that there is a good sense of privacy. Highly recommend.

But no discount was offered and we would have stayed elsewhere had we known it would smell like smoke. I am writing this review a week later so plenty of time was given for Julia to give us some of our money back. The neighbors were also loud, bass was heard throughout the night. The neighborhood didnâ€™t feel safe. I would not recommend staying here.

A lot of thought went into making sure every guest had a nightstand, lamp, dresser, and comfortable bedding. The Hummingbird House can easily accommodate 2 families with room to spare. This house is strictly a rental. You wonâ€™t be staying in someoneâ€™s home with their food, trinkets, or clothes in your way. Richard also recommended Chef Alicia to us to cater our daughterâ€™s FSU graduation dinner. Having the meal prepared and ready to eat when we walked in the house was the way to go!!! Delicious food, beautiful table setting, attention to detail, and no waiting in long lines in college town. Richard also recommended a nearby park/preserve for us to go walking. This was by far the best airbnb experience weâ€™ve had, especially in Tallahassee.

review_text:
I can't say enough good things about our stay at Richard's house! From his flexibility on the number of people we had in the house, to his fantastic and immediate communication, to the cleanliness of everything, to the quiet neighborhood, abundant driveway parking, and OH, the fire pit! I appreciated the little things: nightstands and lights at every bed, nightlights in the hallways, dish and laundry soap and garbage bags available, plenty of seating. Even the hot water heater held up against 20 people.
Everything (appliances, wifi, electrical; even the automatic-closing curtains) worked, the house was close to shopping and dining, and just 15 minutes from FSU and FAMU.
It was amazing, and perfectly suited our large group's needs.
We will be back!

Thank you Richard for letting our large family stay at your lovely property.
It was so peaceful and I liked that it was in a cul-de-sac, made it easy to walk our dogs around in.
Our dogs also enjoyed playing with each other in the large back yard!
The view of your backyard from the upstairs outdoor rap around patio was also very nice and the great weather made it even more enjoyable!
The beds were comfortable and it was great that your kitchen was so big, so that a few family members were able to prepare and cook in it at the same time.
Having the ramps in the back, besides the stairs, to go up and down to the first and second levels and to the driveway, made it much easier for a family member with her handicap stroller.
They also loved having the small bonfire and making s'mores!
It was also very close to FSU which made things quicker!
We hope to visit again in the future!
Sincerely, Lauraine

You will have access to every store (Aldi, Publix, Walgreens, Trader Joes, etc) you need and the FSU campus. The home was equipped with anything you needed to host, super clean, and had non-toxic cleaning and laundry supplies.
This is one of the best Airbnb experiences I have had, other hosts should take note. Thank you Richard for such a great experience and welcome to Tallahassee!

review_text: Captains Quarters is one of the top Airbnb places we have stayed. Jennifer , Paul and her 4 dogs are great hosts. The apartment is very clean, comfortable and inviting. Parking is covered, and guest entry and apartment is separate from the main house. Comfy bed, fabulous shower & bathroom, microwave, kcup coffee maker, toaster oven, small refrigerator, and Roku TV make this a complete set up. Direct access to the pool patio was great and you might even get a visit from the resident dogs who are very friendly. Jennifer and Paul are very accommodating and we enjoyed talking with them. Don't hesitate booking your next Tallahassee area stay at Captains Quarters.
